content.description: A crimpy traverse through the tunnel of Bridge Area.  Good for warm ups or beginners and is very close to the ground.
content.location: Under the actual bridging section of this area, one can climb up through the natural rock tunnel and top out if they wish.  Left side of the tunnel.

content.description: One of the quintessential climbs at Beartown!  Work your way across the bridging part of the boulder with a few sequence options for the middle section.
content.location: Downhill side of Bridge Area.   Standing start is on the left side of the tunnel opening.  Follow the edge of the bridging part of the rock and finish on the upper right corner of this section of the boulder.

content.description: Crunched sit start with some pinches and a small dyno if you're vertically challenged or related to the Baggins'.
content.location: On the right side of the downhill part of Bridge Area, sit start with left hand on the arete and right hand in the jug-ish hold.  Good luck finding feet.  Pop up to a left pinch and then the top of that boulder. Continue up the capstone to top out.

content.description: If you're into some gnarly crimp action and overhung goodness, this is the route for you!  Also dodging the tree... that's important.
content.protection: Crash pads and lots. Spotter(s) suggested as well.

content.description: Just a stone's throw from the parking lot is the Bridge area where there are a handful of routes to play on.
